answers.answer: I do occasionally and it was because I wasn't getting enough iron and needed more protein in the mornings

Hi. I am currently in hospital recovering from C Section. Had a little girl on 26th April at 1:14 AM weighing 2 pound 10. It was only decided the day before at 10 PM that I was having the operation! I has preacclampsia which was not picked up until Wednesday when I had a scan just to check the position of my placenta as at 20 weeks it was low lying. One of the symptoms was 'shower' of moving silver eye floater spot things as well as headaches which I put down to regular pregnancy hormones. I was lucky that mine got picked up. Preacclampsia is very serious. I just wanted to make you aware that it is always better to be safe than sorry. Hope all is well. Please let me know. Xx
I am also getting really bad headaches but only on one side of my head

I get this all the time. Also been having really bad migraines and keep getting flushed. Went to get checked the other day and they found blood and protein in my urine. They have sent a sample away. I have low blood pressure but I've got my iron and sugar levels under control. They think I have an infection but I keep telling them its something else. They never listen.
I went to my 35 week check up and the midwife was useless she didn't check my urine or bp
I know the feeling demi 3054. I've got a few problems which the midwives seem to ignore. Sometimes feels like they can't be bothered doing their job x
How far are you weeshelle93 x
But, remember floaters are normal. Ask your doctor or mention it, but don't start to stress too much. That'll do more harm than good. i see tons of floaters and I don't have preeclampsia.

question: Is anybody else seeing a shower of silver moving eye floaters at least 3 times a day?
title: Eye floaters
